resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: <pre style="font-family: monospace, serif; font-size: 0.9em; caret-color: #000000; text-size-adjust: auto; overflow: auto;">(4)Chosen in the Same Manner <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">during the same ? and by the Same Persons asoften as there shall be Occasion, and in no other Manner andby no other Persons whatsoever and shall hold the said Office of Assistant during good Behaviour. Provided such Ministeror Assistant shall have first obtained the Orders of a Priest of the Established Church of England and be dulyOrdained by a Bishop of the said Church in Great Britainor Ireland and shall by the Congregation or a majority of them, be adjudged soundin his Principles according to the plain literal and Gramatical sense of the Thirty nine Articles of the saidChurch, of a Moral and Religious life and Conversationand well acquainted with Vital and Experimental Piety.
resource.chars:
(4)

Chosen in the Same Manner during the same ? and by the Same Persons as
often as there shall be Occasion, and in no other Manner and
by no other Persons whatsoever and shall hold the said Office of Assistant during good Behaviour. Provided such Minister
or Assistant shall have first obtained the Orders of a 
Priest of the Established Church of England and be duly
Ordained by a Bishop of the said Church in Great Britain
or Ireland and shall by the Congregation or a majority of them, be adjudged sound
in his Principles according to the plain literal and 
Gramatical sense of the Thirty nine Articles of the said
Church, of a Moral and Religious life and Conversation
and well acquainted with Vital and Experimental Piety.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: <pre style="font-family: monospace, serif; font-size: 0.9em; caret-color: #000000; text-size-adjust: auto; overflow: auto;">FourthlyThat for the better Management and Oeconomy of the Revenuesof the Church and for the repairing and preserving theChurch, Church Yard and Burial Ground from decay,There shall be elected and chosen at or in the saidChurch by way of Ballot, and in no other way whatsoever,under the Direction of the former Vestry on Easter Mondayin every Year a new Vestry consisting of 20 <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">of sober Reputable and ReligiousPersons of the Congregation, who shall Superintend takeCare of and repair the said Church, Church Yard and BuryingGround and do and perform all and every other thing thereunto appertainingand shall hire or Rent out the Pews, Collected and Receivethe Pew Money and all <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">other the other Revenues or Incomes ofthe said Church, and from Time to Time appropriate and dispose thereof in such Manner as shall be directed andenjoined them by the Congregation, or a Majority of them bytheir Vote in Manner aforesaid at their general Election on Easter Monday aforesaid in every Year and in no otherManner whatsoever unless it be in the Repairs aforesaidto be performed by the Vestry when and as often as they shallsee Occasion, without such Vote; and that there shall be two ChurchWardens chosen and elected by Ballot on the same day by and out of the Vestry aforesaid for the timebeing <span style="text-decoration: line-through;">who are to be subject to the Vestry who shall be and arehereby made subject to the Orders and Directions of the Vestry and shall have no other orfurther Power and Authority than is hereby given and grantedunto the Vestry.
resource.chars:
Fourthly

That for the better Management and Oeconomy of the Revenues
of the Church and for the repairing and preserving the
Church, Church Yard and Burial Ground from decay,
There shall be elected and chosen at or in the said
Church by way of Ballot, and in no other way whatsoever,
under the Direction of the former Vestry on Easter Monday
in every Year a new Vestry consisting of 20 of sober Reputable and Religious
Persons of the Congregation, who shall Superintend take
Care of and repair the said Church, Church Yard and Burying
Ground and do and perform all and every other thing thereunto appertaining
and shall hire or Rent out the Pews, Collected and Receive
the Pew Money and all other the other Revenues or Incomes of
the said Church, and from Time to Time appropriate and 
dispose thereof in such Manner as shall be directed and
enjoined them by the Congregation, or a Majority of them by
their Vote in Manner aforesaid at their general Election on 
Easter Monday aforesaid in every Year and in no other
Manner whatsoever unless it be in the Repairs aforesaid
to be performed by the Vestry when and as often as they shall
see Occasion, without such Vote; and that there shall be two Church
Wardens chosen and elected by Ballot on the same day by and out of the Vestry aforesaid for the time
being who are to be subject to the Vestry who shall be and are
hereby made subject to the 
Orders and Directions of the 
Vestry and shall have no other or
further Power and Authority than is hereby given and granted
unto the Vestry.
